title: Fat Footer
reference-overview: The Fat Footer is an optional footer container that appears consistently at the bottom of every page. It serves as a secondary navigational element that exposes a deeper level of the site hierarchy to the user.
reference-usage: The Fat Footer should be used in place of the Thin Footer when it is important to expose users to a deeper level of the site structure. This will provide users with a more detailed view of commonly-accessed areas of the site in a secondary manner.
reference-details:
• The width of the Fat Footer will span 100% of the browser window.
  • The content within the Fat Footer will be displayed inside the centered 980px wide content container.
  • Any type of grid layout can be used inside the Fat Footer.
  • The default background color of the Fat Footer is #666666.
  • The default text color of all the content in the Fat Footer is #FFFFFF.
reference-mobile:
• The mobile version of the Fat Footer will continue to span 100% of the available screen space.
  • The items in the Fat Footer will stack on top of each other
  • The overall font size of the content in the Fat Footer will increase.
